latest news.eng_title: Bernard Arnault Surpasses Mark Zuckerberg to Become Third Richest Person in the World
latest news.summary: Bernard Arnault, CEO of LVMH, surpassed Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook's founder, and became the third richest person in the world after a recent increase in LVMH's stock value. Arnault's net worth is approximately US$ 188.6 billion (R$ 1.015 trillion), an increase of US$ 4.54 billion (2.3%) in his shares. In contrast, Zuckerberg's net worth is estimated at US$ 184.7 billion (R$ 1.006 trillion). Arnault, who leads a conglomerate that includes brands such as Louis Vuitton and Tiffany & Co., is behind only Jeff Bezos, Amazon's founder, in the race for the title of second richest person in the world. Bezos has an estimated net worth of US$ 195.7 billion (R$ 1.066 trillion), while Elon Musk remains the richest person in the world with a net worth of approximately US$ 247.4 billion (R$ 1.347 trillion). 'The top of the Forbes Billionaires list has seen many changes throughout the year, with Arnault having occupied the title of the world's richest person at the beginning of the year, before Musk,' according to the article.
latest news.title: Bernard Arnault supera Zuckerberg e retorna ao 3° lugar entre os mais ricos do mundo

latest news.eng_title: *LIST* A Rundown Of The World's Wealthiest People
latest news.summary: According to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, Elon Musk is currently the richest person in the world, with a net worth of approximately $222 billion. He is followed by Jeff Bezos, with an approximate net worth of $186 billion, and Mark Zuckerberg, with an approximate net worth of over $184 billion. The list is based on decades of tracking the world's wealthiest people, starting with the Forbes 400 in 1982 and the world's billionaires since 1987.
latest news.title: *LIST* A Rundown Of The World's Wealthiest People

latest news.eng_title: Bernard Arnault Becomes World's 3rd-Richest Again—Overtaking Mark Zuckerberg
latest news.summary: Bernard Arnault, the chairman and CEO of LVMH, has surpassed Mark Zuckerberg as the third-richest person in the world, with a net worth of approximately $188.6 billion. This comes after LVMH's shares surged 2.6% to over $675, while Meta's shares decreased slightly. Arnault is behind Jeff Bezos for the title of the world's second-richest person, with an estimated net worth of $195.7 billion, while Elon Musk remains the world's wealthiest person with an estimated net worth of $247.4 billion. This is the latest in a series of trades among the world's richest individuals, with Arnault and Zuckerberg previously swapping places multiple times in recent weeks.
latest news.title: Bernard Arnault Becomes World's 3rd-Richest Again—Overtaking Mark Zuckerberg

latest news.eng_title: Here's A Rundown Of The World's Wealthiest People
latest news.summary: According to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, Elon Musk is now the richest person in the world, with a net worth of approximately $222 billion. He surpasses Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, who comes in second with an approximate net worth of $186 billion. Mark Zuckerberg, co-founder of Meta, ranks third with an approximate net worth of over $184 billion. The list, which has been tracking the world's billionaires since 1987, provides a snapshot of the ever-changing net worth of the world's wealthiest individuals.
latest news.title: Here's A Rundown Of The World's Wealthiest People

latest news.eng_title: A Rundown of The World's Richest People
latest news.summary: According to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, Elon Musk is currently the richest person in the world, with a net worth of approximately $222 billion as of earlier this month. He is followed by Jeff Bezos, with an approximate net worth of $186 billion, and Mark Zuckerberg, who has an approximate net worth of over $184 billion. This ranking is subject to change due to fluctuations in the stock market.
latest news.title: A Rundown of The World's Richest People

latest news.eng_title: A Rundown Of The World's Wealthiest People
latest news.summary: According to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, Elon Musk is now the richest person in the world, with a net worth of approximately $222 billion. He is followed by Jeff Bezos, with an approximate net worth of $186 billion, and Mark Zuckerberg, with an approximate net worth of over $184 billion. The list, which has been tracking the world's billionaires since 1987, is updated daily due to fluctuations in the stock market.
latest news.title: A Rundown Of The World's Wealthiest People

latest news.eng_title: Who is the richest person in the world? See net worths of Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, more
latest news.summary: According to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, Elon Musk is the richest person in the world with an approximate net worth of $222 billion as of early August 2024. Musk is the founder of SpaceX and The Boring Company and co-founder of PayPal and brain technology company Neuralink. Amazon founder Jeff Bezos has a net worth of approximately $186 billion and clocks in as the second richest person in the world. Microsoft co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates has a net worth of approximately $130 billion and is the eighth richest person in the world. Mark Zuckerberg is currently the third richest person in the world with a net worth of approximately $180 billion. The net worths of billionaires change daily due to fluctuations in the stock market.
latest news.title: Who is the richest person in the world? See net worths of Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, more

news knowledge.eng_title: Forbes' 2024 Richest People List: Elon Musk Remains at the Top, Warren Buffett Falls to 10th Place
news knowledge.summary: The Forbes '2024 July's richest people' list has seen some notable changes. Elon Musk, owner of Tesla, has maintained his top spot, while Warren Buffett has fallen to 10th place due to his large donations. Buffett distributed approximately $5.3 billion in Berkshire Hathaway shares in late June and saw a slight decrease in the value of his shares, marking the first time in years he has fallen so far in the rankings. Bernard Arnault, the French luxury goods king, has fallen to third place due to the decline in LVMH stock, while Jeff Bezos has risen to second place after Amazon's market value surpassed $2 trillion for the first time in June. Larry Ellison, the founder of Oracle, has seen his wealth increase by $26.8 billion after Oracle's stock reached an all-time high, making him the biggest gainer in June, as he said, 'It was a great day for Oracle.'
news knowledge.title: Forbes'un en zenginler listesi tepetaklak! Sonuncu sıralaya gerileyen milyarder kim?

news knowledge.eng_title: The 5 richest folks on this planet in 2024
news knowledge.summary: Forbes has released its list of the 5 richest people in 2024, with Bernard Arnault, a French businessman, topping the list for the first time, surpassing Elon Musk. Arnault's net worth is estimated to be $226.2 billion, thanks to the continued growth of his company LVMH, which owns iconic brands such as Louis Vuitton and Dior. Elon Musk, the South African entrepreneur, comes in second with a net worth of $195.3 billion, due to the success of Tesla and SpaceX. Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, is third with a net worth of $194.9 billion, despite a slight drop in his fortune this year. Mark Zuckerberg, the creator of Facebook, is fourth with a net worth of $177 billion, and Larry Ellison, a co-founder of Oracle, rounds out the top 5 with a net worth of $141 billion.
news knowledge.title: The 5 richest folks on this planet in 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: Forbes Releases List of World's 10 Richest People in July 2024
news knowledge.summary: According to Forbes, Elon Musk remains the richest person in the world, with a net worth estimated at US$ 228.6 billion. His fortune increased by US$ 11.1 billion (R$ 61.9 billion) since June 1st and almost US$ 19 billion (R$ 106 billion) in the last two months. Jeff Bezos, the owner of Amazon, is in second place with an estimated net worth of US$ 212.9 billion, which increased by US$ 15.5 billion (R$ 86.4 billion) in the last month. Bernard Arnault, the owner of LVMH, fell to third place, with a net worth of US$ 193.3 billion. The top 10 richest people in the world have a combined net worth of US$ 1.66 trillion (R$ 9.2 trillion), which is US$ 76 billion (R$ 424 billion) more than last month.
news knowledge.title: Quem são os 10 bilionários mais ricos do mundo em julho, segundo a Forbes

news knowledge.eng_title: Amazon's 30th Anniversary: The Story of Jeff Bezos' Rise to Success
news knowledge.summary: Amazon is celebrating its 30th anniversary today, July 5, 2024. Behind the giant is Jeff Bezos, a well-known figure who embodies the American myth of the small entrepreneur who started from scratch and is now one of the richest men in the world. The story begins in a garage in Seattle, where Bezos created Amazon in 1994. He shared a video on his Instagram account showing his early technical installations, a computer and a photocopier. Bezos, a passionate reader and computer scientist, left his job on Wall Street to start Amazon, which initially focused on creating the world's largest bookstore. The company's growth was rapid, and in 1997, Amazon went public. Since then, Bezos has sold over $27 billion worth of Amazon shares, making him one of the richest people in the world. Today, he is the second richest person on the planet, with a fortune estimated by Forbes to be $210 billion. He has also invested in various companies, including Google, Uber, and Airbnb, and has developed new projects such as a streaming service and a space tourism company, Blue Origin.
news knowledge.title: Amazon a 30 ans, l'histoire d'un libraire devenu multimilliardaire

news knowledge.eng_title: Amazon's 30th Anniversary: A Look at the Company's Extraordinary Evolution
news knowledge.summary: Amazon is celebrating its 30th anniversary, having been founded in 1994 by Jeff Bezos. The company has become one of the most powerful in the world, generating significant profits, including $636 per second in 2023, which is approximately €590. In 2023, Amazon's profits reached over $20 billion. This success has made Jeff Bezos one of the richest people in the world, with an estimated fortune of $214 billion, ranking him as the second-richest person in the world behind Elon Musk, according to Forbes. Amazon's evolution from an online bookstore to a global e-commerce giant has been extraordinary, with the company occupying a unique and influential position among the GAFAM (Google, Apple, Facebook, Amazon, and Microsoft).
news knowledge.title: 30 ans d'Amazon : voici la somme gagnée chaque seconde par le géant du e-commerce, selon une étude

news knowledge.eng_title: Amazon's 30th Anniversary: Jeff Bezos' Fortune Reaches $210 Billion
news knowledge.summary: Amazon is celebrating its 30th anniversary on July 5, 2024. Founded by Jeff Bezos in 1994, the company has generated billions of dollars in profits each year. Bezos' personal fortune has grown significantly, making him the second richest person in the world with an estimated net worth of $210 billion (194 billion euros), according to Forbes. Bezos was the richest person in the world from 2018 to 2021, but is now surpassed by Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla and X, with a net worth of $221 billion (204 billion euros). Bezos' fortune comes mainly from Amazon, which he founded as an online bookstore. He has sold over $27 billion (25 billion euros) worth of Amazon shares since the company went public in 1997 and now owns less than 10% of the company. Bezos has made headlines in recent years for his massive earnings, including a record-breaking $13 billion (12 billion euros) in a single day in 2020.
news knowledge.title: 30 ans d'Amazon : à combien s'élève la fortune de Jeff Bezos, son fondateur ?

news knowledge.eng_title: Elon Musk tops Forbes list of world's richest individuals for 2024
news knowledge.summary: According to Forbes' latest rankings, Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, has become the world's wealthiest individual with a net worth of USD221.4 billion. He is followed by Jeff Bezos, founder of Amazon, with a net worth of USD210.2 billion. The top 10 richest people have a collective wealth of approximately USD1.66 trillion, a USD76 million increase from the previous month. The list includes Bernard Arnault, Mark Zuckerberg, Larry Ellison, Larry Page, Sergey Brin, Bill Gates, Steve Ballmer, and Warren Buffett.
news knowledge.title: Elon Musk tops Forbes list of world's richest individuals for 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: Jeff Bezos Regains Second Spot as World's Richest Person
news knowledge.summary: Jeff Bezos, the founder of Amazon, has returned to being the second richest person in the world, according to Forbes' real-time billionaire ranking. With an estimated net worth of $210.6 billion, Bezos surpassed Bernard Arnault, president and CEO of LVMH, who has a net worth of $195 billion and now ranks third. The high value of Amazon's stock, which has increased by 27% this year and 130% since the start of last year, has contributed to Bezos' increased wealth, according to Forbes. The company, led by CEO Andy Jassy, has just reported its most profitable quarter in history, with a net profit of $10.4 billion. Forbes also notes that Amazon's stock has benefited from investor interest in artificial intelligence. Elon Musk remains the richest person in the world, with a net worth of $220.6 billion.
news knowledge.title: Jeff Bezos desbanca Bernard Arnault e volta a ser 2° pessoa mais rica do mundo; veja ranking

news knowledge.eng_title: Jeff Bezos becomes second richest person in the world after Amazon surpasses $2 trillion
news knowledge.summary: Jeff Bezos has returned to being the second richest person in the world after Amazon surpassed $2 trillion in market value. The company became the fifth US company to reach this milestone, driven by technology stocks fueled by artificial intelligence and expectations of interest rate cuts in the United States.
news knowledge.title: Jeff Bezos volta a ser a segunda pessoa mais rica do mundo após Amazon ultrapassar US$ 2 trilhões

news knowledge.eng_title: The World's Richest Billionaires In 2024, Ranked
news knowledge.summary: According to Forbes's real-time billionaires list, the world's richest people have been ranked. Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tops the list with a net worth of $205.4 billion, followed closely by Amazon founder Jeff Bezos ($203.2 billion) and luxury goods company LMVH's CEO Bernard Arnault & family ($200 billion). Mark Zuckerberg, who wasn't in the top 10 last year, now ranks fourth with a net worth of $176.5 billion.
news knowledge.title: The World's Richest Billionaires In 2024, Ranked
